{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of extreme fatigue and jaundice, along with his history of illicit intravenous drug use, suggest a viral hepatitis infection. The hepatitis panel results can help us determine the type of hepatitis. Anti-HAV IgM being negative rules out acute hepatitis A. Anti-HCV and Anti-HDV being negative rules out hepatitis C and D. The presence of HBsAg and IgM anti-HBc indicates an acute hepatitis B infection. If it was a past infection, Anti-HBs would be positive, which it is not.", "answer_choice": "D. Acute hepatitis B"}
